TUESDAY THE 13TH IS UNLUCKY IN GREECE.  iStock While Americans are generally superstitious about Friday the 13th, Greeks are traditionally wary of Tuesdays, and especially. The rationale for the superstition goes all the way back to Tuesday, April 13, 1204 (on the Julian calendar), when Constantinople to the Crusaders. That wasn't the only unlucky Tuesday for the Greeks: On Tuesday,Constantinople fell to the Ottomans. One 19th-century travel writer said that he heard that Greeks even on a Tuesday. 4.
